title: Jimi Hendrix Experience at Polytechnic
description: Jimi Hendrix guest appearance with Cream at Regent Street Polytechnic. Hendrix performed a legendary version of "Killing Floor" that stunned Eric Clapton and the audience. This impromptu jam session is considered a pivotal moment in rock history, marking Hendrix's dramatic entry into the British music scene.

sources.title: Jimi Hendrix at the Polytechnic - YouTube
Eric Clapton Autobiography
sources.notes: Clapton's memoir containing his account of meeting Hendrix

sources.title: The Night Jimi Hendrix Killed God - Louder Sound
sources.notes: Detailed account with multiple witness testimonies

excerpts.excerpt_text: He played it exactly like it ought to be played, and he totally blew me away.
excerpts.speaker: Eric Clapton

excerpts.excerpt_text: You never told me he was that fucking good.
excerpts.speaker: Eric Clapton to Chas Chandler
excerpts.source_title: The Night Jimi Hendrix Killed God - Louder Sound

excerpts.excerpt_text: He plugged into my bass amp and just blew us all away.
excerpts.speaker: Jack Bruce (Cream bassist)
excerpts.source_title: The Night Jimi Hendrix Killed God - Louder Sound

excerpts.excerpt_text: When Hendrix took the stage, it tipped right over the edge.
excerpts.speaker: Nick Mason (Pink Floyd)
excerpts.source_title: The Night Jimi Hendrix Killed God - Louder Sound

excerpts.excerpt_text: The look of absolute shock on Clapton's face.
excerpts.speaker: Neil Slaven (record producer)
excerpts.source_title: The Night Jimi Hendrix Killed God - Louder Sound
